p: Only three articles had proposed possible intercity and cross‐border transmission of sexually acquired HCV, based on the analyses of a small number of samples. Five intercity clusters were described in Australia (4 and 1 of subtype 1a and 3a respectively), each involving only three to eight sequences from Brisbane, Melbourne, Perth and Sydney [ 13]. Intercity transmission was also suggested in China, where two sequences of subtype 2a from Hubei were shown to cluster with another two from Guangdong [ 17]. An incident of cross‐border transmission was speculated when a sequence from Taipei was identified within a large cluster of subtype 3a among MSM in Hong Kong [ 20].
